div1.p: Hench discusses the speech he gave for the Cornwell painting unveiling.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Mrs. J. deJ. Pemberton, January 7, 1942
div1.p:
Thank you so much for your kind note about my
talk. I was glad to show it to Mary and my mother and
they were also very pleased.

It was a real pleasure for me to tell this
story again. As you can see, I never get tired of tell-
ing it and if you personally should happen to want me
to give it before any other local organization at any
time, I shall be very glad to do so.
div1.closer:
Always sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. Mrs. J. deJ. Pemberton
930 Eighth Street S. W.
Rochester, Minnesota
